metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4387 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
net/ipv6/ip6_output.c in the Linux kernel through 3.11.4 does not properly determine the need for UDP Fragmentation Offload (UFO) processing of small packets after the UFO queueing of a large packet, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via network traffic that triggers a large response packet. Dmitry Vyukov reported a flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of IPv6 UDP Fragmentation Offload (UFO) processing. A remote attacker could leverage this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
